member.name: M:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.Clear
member.summary: Clears the current report.
member.remarks:
This method removes all groups, group sections, fields and parameters, it resets the collection so it will contain single object with name "Main". Resets properties of all nested objects like , etc. Clears (but does not remove) the fixed sections that all reports have: Detail, Header, Footer, PageHeader, and PageFooter.
Use this method when you want to clear a report and start creating a new one from scratch.

member.name: M:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.Evaluate(System.String)
member.summary: Evaluates a VBScript expression in the current report context.
member.param: A string with a VBScript expression to be evaluated.
member.returns: The value of the expression.

remarks.para: Use this method to evaluate expressions as they would be evaluated while generating a report. This can be useful in designer-type applications, to provide an "Immediate Window" where users can test expressions.

If the expression string contains invalid syntax or causes an evaluation error, the control raises the event. In this case, the Handled parameter of the event is set to true, so the exception is ignored by default.

example.para: Expressions may contain simple VBScript expressions such as:
Expressions may also contain references to the Report object and all its sub-objects. For example:
Finally, data fields, , and objects may be referenced directly by name.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.RightToLeft
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the fields of the report should use right-to-left rules for rendering text.
If null (which is the default), the value of the static property is used.
This value may be overridden by individual fields.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.ActualRightToLeft
member.summary:
Gets the actual right-to-left value that is being used. The value is obtained using the following rules:
If is not null, then that value is used.
If the current report is a sub-report, then of the owner subreport field is used.
Else the value of static property is used.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.AvailableHeight
member.summary: Gets the height of the remaining area available for sections on the current page. This property can only be used while the report is being rendered in paginated mode (i.e. when and are true). If is false then -1 is returned. If is false then double.MaxValue is returned. Note that if used in OnPrint/OnFormat scripts, this value does NOT account for the current section's height. For subreports this property returns of the master report.
member.remarks:
Here is an example of code which can be used in the detail section's OnFormat script to determine whether the current detail section will be the last one printed on the page (the test checks that the current section will fit onto the page while the next section won't):
h = Detail.RenderHeight ah = Report.AvailableHeight if (h < ah) and (2 * h > ah) then Detail.BackColor = RGB(255, 0, 0) ' last on page else Detail.BackColor = RGB(255, 255, 255) endif

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.Groups
member.summary: Gets a collection with all the groups in the report.

remarks.para: The Groups collection contains all objects defined in the current report.
Removing a Group from the collection also removes its associated header and footer sections, as well as any fields in those sections.
Adding a Group to the collection adds the corresponding group header and footer sections to the report.

This property is updated automatically when a report is loaded from a file. If you load a report definition from a or via the property, make sure that WorkingDirectory has the correct value if the report template contains items with relative file names. If this property is null then is used, otherwise is used.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.ReportInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets a object containing report metadata.

remarks.para: Reports may include general information such as a title, author, and keywords.

Such global information about the document itself (as opposed to its content or structure) is called metadata, and is intended to assist in cataloguing and searching for reports and report definitions in external databases.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.DataSource
member.summary: Gets or sets a reference to the report's main , or null if the report is unbound.

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the report's main data source. This name should match the name of a data source in the collection.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.Layout
member.summary: Gets a reference to the report's object.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.MaxPages
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of pages allowed for a report.

remarks.para: This property is useful if you want to limit the maximum number of pages in a report.
For example, you may write a report designer with a preview window that shows only the first five pages of a report.
Setting this property to zero allows reports of any length.
You can also limit the size of reports by setting the property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.DoEvents
member.summary: Specifies whether the control should handle Windows messages while rendering reports in synchronious mode.

remarks.para: Setting this property to true allows users to resize forms, click buttons, etc. while reports are being generated in synchronious mode. This makes applications more responsive, and is necessary if you want to provide a "Cancel Report" button (otherwise users wouldn't be able to click the button until the report was done).
Setting this property to false will cause reports to render slightly faster.

example.para: The code below implements "Render" and a "Cancel" buttons attached to a component.

The "Render" button checks whether the component is busy before starting to render a report. This is necessary because the user could click the "Render" button several times in a row, before the component got a chance to finish rendering the report. (Calling the method while the component is busy throws an ).
The "Cancel" button checks whether the component is rendering a report and sets the property to true.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.Cancel
member.summary: Specifies whether to cancel generation of the current report.
member.remarks: Setting this property to true while a report is being generated stops the report generation process. Any pages already created are kept in the document and can be previewed or printed by an attached print preview control.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.OnOpen
member.summary: Gets or sets the VBScript that is executed when the report starts rendering.

remarks.para: The control also fires the event at this time.

The difference between the regular event and the VBScript property is that the handler for the regular event belongs to the application, and should thus be used to support tasks that are independent of the report. For example, to display a message on the main window when rendering starts.

The VBScript handler in the property belongs to the report, and will be executed regardless of the application. For example, a report might contain a VBScript handler that resets global variables in the VBScript context when a report starts rendering.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.OnClose
member.summary: Gets or sets the VBScript that is executed when the report finishes rendering.

remarks.para: The control also fires the event at this time.

The difference between the regular event and the VBScript property is that the handler for the regular event belongs to the application, and should thus be used to support tasks that are independent of the report. For example, to display a message on the main window when rendering finishes.

The VBScript handler in the property belongs to the report, and will be executed regardless of the application. For example, a report might contain a VBScript handler that resets global variables in the VBScript context when a report starts rendering.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.OnNoData
member.summary: Gets or sets the VBScript that is executed when the report starts rendering and its source recordset is empty.

remarks.para: The control also fires the event at this time.

The difference between the regular event and the VBScript property is that the handler for the regular event belongs to the application, and should thus be used to support tasks that are independent of the report. For example, to cancel rendering reports with no data.

The VBScript handler in the property belongs to the report, and will be executed regardless of the application. For example, a report might contain a VBScript handler that changes the value of a field when the source recordset is empty.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.OnPage
member.summary: Gets or sets the VBScript that is executed when a new page is created.

remarks.para: The control also fires the event at this time.

The difference between the regular event and the VBScript property is that the handler for the regular event belongs to the application, and should thus be used to support tasks that are independent of the report. For example, to update a label showing how many pages have been rendered so far.

The VBScript handler in the property belongs to the report, and will be executed regardless of the application. For example, a report might contain a VBScript handler that updates a variable at every page break.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.OnError
member.summary: Gets or sets the VBScript that is executed when an error occurs.

remarks.para: The control also fires the event at this time.

The difference between the regular event and the VBScript property is that the handler for the regular event belongs to the application, and should thus be used to support tasks that are independent of the report. For example, to display a an application dialog box when an error occurs.

The VBScript handler in the property belongs to the report, and will be executed regardless of the application. For example, a report might contain a VBScript handler that changes the value of a field when an error occurs.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.GlobalScripts
member.summary: Gets or sets the global VBScript module. Functions and subroutines defined here (using the standard VBScript syntax) can be used in other scripts in the current report like standard VBScript functions.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.LabelOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the first label on a partially used sheet.
member.remarks: This property allows you to print labels on partially used label sheets. For example, if you have a sheet with 12 labels and have already used 5, set the LabelOffset property to 6 in order to skip the labels that have already been used.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.GrowShrinkMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the method used to process CanGrow/CanShrink fields.

remarks.para: If this property is set to , fields with or properties set to true will move fields directly below them when they grow or shrink. Fields located below but off to the side are not moved.

If this property is set to , fields that grow or shrink will affect all fields below, even those which are not directly under the field that was modified as a result of CanGrow/CanShrink. (This is the Microsoft Access behavior).
For example, if fields are arranged in a grid layout and is set to , fields within each row will remain vertically aligned when fields above them grow or shrink.
If is set to , fields within each column will move independently of fields in other columns, and fields within each row will not remain vertically aligned.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.IgnoreScriptErrors
member.summary: Specifies whether the component should ignore script errors by default.

remarks.para: When the script interpreter finds an error in a script or expression, the component raises the event. This property specifies the default value for the Handled parameter in that event.
If IgnoreScriptErrors is set to true, script errors are ignored by default (the Handled parameter is initialized to true).
If IgnoreScriptErrors is set to false, script errors throw exceptions by default (the Handled parameter is initialized to false).
In either case, the event handler may override the default by changing the value of the Handled parameter.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.ExposeScriptObjects
member.summary: Specifies whether script objects of report should be exposed to subreports.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.RecordsPerPage
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of detail records to render per page or group.

remarks.para: This is useful when printing forms that must have a specific number of rows.
If the number of records is greater than the value specified, group or page breaks are added to limit the number of records rendered in each group of detail sections.
If the number of detail records is smaller than the value specified, blank records are added so the group of detail sections has the specified number of records.
If this property is set to zero (the default value), then it has no effect.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.Page
member.summary: Gets or sets the current page number.

remarks.para: This property is a global variable available to VBScript expressions.
It is automatically initialized by the control with the value 1 when a report starts rendering, and it is automatically incremented after each page break.
This property is read-write, so you can reset it using scripts. For example, you can reset the current page to 1 whenever a new group starts rendering.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.ParentReport
member.summary: Gets the main report that contains this subreport (null for main reports).

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.ReportDefinition
member.summary: Gets or sets an Xml string containing the complete report definition.
member.remarks: This property can be used to store report definitions into databases, to place them in the clipboard, or to copy reports from one component to another.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.Watermark
member.summary: Gets the object defining properties of the report's watermark.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.Overlay
member.summary: Gets the object defining properties of the report's overlay.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.FormatVersion
member.summary: Gets the object specifying the version of the report definition files.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.DefaultRightToLeft
member.summary: Gets or sets the value used as the default for the property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.DefaultBasePath
member.summary: Gets or sets the default directory that is used to resolve relative file names. By default this property is null, in which case Enviroment.CurrentDirectory is used.

member.name: E:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.RenderCompleted
member.summary: Occurs when the method has completed.

member.name: E:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.ReportDefinitionChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the current report definition changes.

member.name: E:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.StartReport
member.summary: Occurs when the report starts rendering, before it opens the datasources and checks parameters.

remarks.para: You can use this event to provide user feedback or to make changes to the datasources properties.
For example, you may implement your own version of parameterized queries by asking the user to provide some information and changing the property accordingly.

You may also use this event to assign a object directly to the report's property. Applications that already have the report data should do this to save time by preventing from loading its own copy of the data.

member.name: E:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.EndReport
member.summary: Occurs when the report finishes rendering.

member.name: E:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.ReportError
member.summary: Occurs when an error occurs while rendering a report.

remarks.para: The most common types of errors found when rendering reports are:

1) Invalid connection string or SQL query. This usually indicates that the system could not open the specified database (a server may be off line, or a database file may be in a different location than what was specified) or that the SQL syntax used for the contains errors.

2) Error executing scripts or evaluating expressions. This usually indicates that the VBScript expression used contains a syntax error. In these cases, make sure you look at the exception message. It usually contains a good explanation of what caused the error.

member.name: E:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.GetScriptObject
member.summary: Occurs when an unknown object is found in the report's script or expression.

member.name: E:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.NoData
member.summary: Occurs when the report starts rendering and the main report data source is empty.

remarks.para: You can use this event to cancel rendering a report when the source recordset is empty.
If you don't cancel the report, it will be rendered as an unbound report (a self-contained report with no underlying data).

member.name: E:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.StartSection
member.summary: Occurs before each is formatted.

remarks.para: When this event fires, the report fields have not been updated with the current values or sizes.
This is a good point to set field formatting parameters and visibility based on the current data values.
This event is equivalent to the script property.

member.name: E:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.PrintSection
member.summary: Occurs before each is printed (after it has been formatted.)

remarks.para: When this event fires, the field values and sizes have been set by the control.
You may still make changes, but they will not affect the field layout. For example, changing a field's property at this point will not cause it to grow or shrink.
This event is equivalent to the script property.

member.name: E:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.StartPage
member.summary: Occurs when a new page starts rendering.

remarks.para: This event is useful for updating the user interface to show how many pages have been printed so far.
You can use the property while handling this event to cancel rendering the report. To limit the number of pages that can be printed, use the property instead.

member.name: E:C1.Win.FlexReport.C1FlexReport.EndPage
member.summary: Occurs when a page finishes rendering.

remarks.para: This event is useful for updating the user interface to show how many pages have been printed so far.
You can use the property while handling this event to cancel rendering the report. To limit the number of pages that can be printed, use the property instead.

member.summary: Adds a to the collection. This overload adds a legacy field type and is deprecated.
member.param: Contains the name of the new field. You should use a consistent naming scheme for the fields and avoid using duplicate names for report fields and database fields. Using repeated names is legal but will cause VBScript expressions that use repeated field names to yield unexpected results.

Contains the value for the new field's property. This value may be treated as a literal or as a VBScript expression, depending on the setting of the field's property. By default, is set to false and the text is rendered as-is.
Left coordinate of the new field, in twips, with respect to its containing section.
Top coordinate of the new field, in twips, with respect to its containing section.
Width of the new field, in twips.
Height of the new field, in twips.
member.returns: A reference to the newly added field.

remarks.para: If you add a field to a section's collection, the new field is automatically assigned to that section.
If you add a field to the control's collection, the new field is not assigned to any sections. In this case, you must set the field's property or it will not be rendered in the report.

member.name: T:C1.Win.FlexReport.DataSource
member.summary: Represnts a data source in a .

remarks.para: Most reports specify their data sources by setting the and properties. The DataSource object uses these values to connect to a database and retrieve the report data.

Alternatively, you can assign data objects directly to the property. This approach is more efficient in scenarios where the data has already been loaded by the application for other purposes, and can be used in the report directly instead of loading a copy.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.DataSource.EncloseParameterValues
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether values of parameters in resulting SQL query should be enclosed with delimiters, "#" for dates, "'" for strings, "()" for multivalue parameters. If this parameter is false when all parameters in already should be enclosed. For example, EncloseParameterValues == true: RecordSource = "select * from customers where name = CustomerName"; actual SQL query will be: select * from customers where name = 'Some customer'
EncloseParameterValues == false: RecordSource = "select * from customers where name = 'CustomerName'"; actual SQL query will be: select * from customers where name = 'Some customer'

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.DataSource.DataProvider
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the data source. The data source type determines the syntaxes of connection string and query (record source). The default is Auto but it is recommended that you set this value to the specific type of the data source you are using, as automatic determining of the data source type may be rather slow.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.DataSource.ConnectionString
member.summary: Gets or sets the connection string used to open a database.

remarks.para: This property is used by the class to load the report data.
While ConnectionString specifies the database that contains the data, specifies which table, stored procedure, or Sql command to use for retrieving the data.

The syntax of ConnectionString is determined by the type of the data provider used by . For example if DataProvider is then ConnectionString should use syntax used in OleDbConnection, if DataProvider is , it should contain the name of the XML file, and so on.
If you want to use a different type of connection (e.g. a , or if your application already has the data available in a object, you can assign the data directly to the property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.DataSource.RecordSource
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that specifies which table, stored procedure, or Sql command to use for retrieving the report data.

remarks.para: The specifies the database that contains the report data. The property specifies which table, stored procedure, or Sql command to use for retrieving the data.
If you want to use a different type of connection (e.g. a , or if your application already has the data available in a object, you can assign the data directly to the property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.DataSource.RecordSourceType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the (stored procedure, table, sql query etc.).

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.DataSource.FilterSyntax
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of syntax used in the .

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.DataSource.Filter
member.summary: Gets or sets the expression used to filter which data rows are included in the report.

remarks.para: Use the Filter property to restrict the records that you want to include in a data source without modifying the property.

Using a filter is similar to specifying a WHERE clause in the SQL statement assigned to the property. Both techniques will filter the data according to the condition specified. The difference is that the Filter property is applied to a table that has already been loaded in memory, while the WHERE statement causes only the filtered records to be loaded from the database into memory.

When creating reports that include only small subsets large tables, the WHERE statement is a better option, because it doesn't require the entire table to be loaded into memory. On the other hand, if the table has already been loaded in memory, the Filter property is a better option, since it does not require any additional data to be loaded.
The syntax for the filter expression is determined by the property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.DataSource.MaxRecords
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of data rows to be included in the report (zero includes all rows).

remarks.para: This property is useful if you want to limit the size of a report. For example, you may write a report designer with a preview window that shows only the first 500 records from the database.
Setting this property to zero causes the control to retrieve all records.
You can also limit the size of reports by setting the property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.DataSource.CommandTimeOut
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of seconds to wait before the data connection times out (set to -1 to use the default value, usually 30s).

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.DataSource.Recordset
member.summary: Sets or gets the data source object that provides data to the report.

remarks.para: Usually, the control creates a data object based on the value of the and properties, and uses that object as the report data source.
Alternatively, you may want to create the data source object yourself, and assign it to the control. You can do that by assigning your data source object to the Recordset property.
remarks.value: You can assign objects of the following types to the property: (1) objects, (2) objects, or (3) any object that implements the or interface.

The default is IsolationLevel.ReadCommitted.

member.name: T:C1.Win.FlexReport.IC1FlexReportExternalRecordset
member.summary:
Represents an external record set residing in a separate assembly.
If an assembly contains a type supporting this interface, that assembly and type can be selected in the report designer as the data source for a report. A reference to that type and the record set initialization parameters (see ) are then saved in the XML report definition file. When the report is loaded, the recordset object is created based on the saved info, and used as the data source for the report.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.FieldBase.Left
member.summary: Gets or sets the X coordinate of the field's left edge in twips.

remarks.para: A field's location is the distance from its upper left corner to the upper left corner of its containing .
Setting the or property to zero places the field at the very left or top of its containing section.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.FieldBase.Top
member.summary: Gets or sets the Y coordinate of the field's top edge in twips.

remarks.para: A field's location is the distance from its upper left corner to the upper left corner of its containing .

If the field's properties are set to true, the control will automatically adjust the property to fit the field's contents and the property of fields below the current field to preserve the vertical distance between fields. The value of the and properties is not affected.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.FieldBase.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the field in twips.

remarks.para: Every object has a rectangle, or "field box", where the field contents are rendered.
The field box is defined by the , , , and properties.
These properties are expressed in twips, and the position is relative to the field's containing section.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.FieldBase.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the field in twips.

remarks.para: Every object has a rectangle, or "field box", where the field contents are rendered.
The field box is defined by the , , , and properties.
These properties are expressed in twips, and the position is relative to the field's containing section.
The field's property should be set to a value larger than or equal to the height of the field's , or no text will appear in the field.

If the field's property are set to true, the control will automatically adjust the property to fit the field's contents and the property of fields below the current field to preserve the vertical distance between fields. The value of the and properties is not affected.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.FieldBase.Right
member.summary: Gets the x-coordinate of the field's right edge in twips.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.FieldBase.Bottom

member.remarks: This property is useful for rendering fields with borders or solid backgrounds, to add some space between the borders and the field content.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.FieldBase.MarginTop
member.summary: Gets or sets the spacing between the top edge of the field and its content, in twips.
member.remarks: This property is useful for rendering fields with borders or solid backgrounds, to add some space between the borders and the field content.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.FieldBase.MarginRight

member.remarks: This property is useful for rendering fields with borders or solid backgrounds, to add some space between the borders and the field content.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining whether to insert page breaks before or after the field.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining how height of object changes depending on its content.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.FieldBase.AutoWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining how width of object changes depending on its content.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.FieldBase.SplitVertBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining how the object is treated when it is too high to fit in the vertical space available on the current page.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.FieldBase.SplitHorzBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining how the object is treated when it is too wide to fit in the horizontal space available on the current page.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.FieldBase.KeepTogether
member.summary: Specifies whether the field should be kept together on a page.

remarks.para: If this property is set to true, the control will insert page breaks in order to keep the field contents together on a page.
If it is set to false, and the containing also has its property set to false, then the field may be rendered across two or more pages.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.FieldBase.Anchor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining how the field's vertical position changes relative to its containing .

remarks.para: Normally, fields do not move when sections grow or shrink. In some cases, however, you may want fields to grow with the section or to stay in the same position relative to the bottom of the section.
This is especially common for fields used to create vertical lines that should extend the entire height of the section.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.FieldBase.ZOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets the ZOrder of the field.

remarks.para: The ZOrder of a field determines whether it is rendered in front of or behind other fields that overlap with it.
High ZOrder values bring the field to the front, low values send it to the back.
Because ZOrder values are relative, it is usually easier to call the method, which ensures the field is rendered in front of or behind all other overlapping fields.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.FieldBase.RightToLeft
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether right-to-left text rendering rules should be used. If null (which is the default), the property defined on the report is used.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.FieldBase.ActualRightToLeft
member.summary: Gets the actual right-to-left value that is being used. If the field's own is not null, that value is returned. Otherwise the defined on the report is returned.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.FieldBase.RenderHeight

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Field.WritingMode

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Field.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the field's calculated value.

remarks.para: When a field's property is set to true, the control evaluates the expression stored in the property and stores the result in the property, which gets rendered into the report.
This is the field's default property, so when you use a field name in a VBScript expression, you are actually referring to the field's property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Field.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the field's text.

remarks.para: The property contains the text that will be rendered on the report.
This value may be rendered literally (without any translation) or it may be evaluated as a VBScript expression, depending on the setting of the property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Field.Subreport
member.summary: Gets or sets a reference to another report to be rendered within the field (a subreport).

remarks.para: A subreport is a report that is inserted in another report. Subreports are useful when you want to combine several reports into one. For example, you may have a main report that integrates several subreports into a single main report. Or you can use the main report to show detailed information and use subreports to show summary data at the beginning of each group.
For some real-world examples, check the "Sales By Category" and "Sales By Year" reports in the NWIND.XML sample that ships with the control.
To define a field as a subreport, you should start by loading the subreport, then assign the subreport control to the field's property.

Next, link the subreport to the main report using the subreport field's property (this is analogous to setting the LinkChildFields/LinkMasterFields properties in a Microsoft Access subreport). The Text property in a subreport field is used as a filter. It specifies which records in the source recordset should be used to render the subreport based on the current record for the main report.
When the main report is being rendered and reaches the subreport field, the Text expression is evaluated and the result is uses as a filter condition for the subreport.
Building the link expression is not difficult, but it is a little tricky because it requires you to create a string that contains quotes, and these internal quotes must be doubled (written as "").

If you are creating reports using the Report Designer, you don't have to worry about building the link expressions in code. Instead, right-click the subreport field and select the Link Subreport... menu. This will show a dialog where you can select the master and detail fields. When you click OK, the Report Designer will build the link expression and assign it to the Text property of the subreport field automatically.
Subreport fields usually have the property set to , so the subreport field can expand to include all its records.

Subreports may contain other subreports. There's no set limit for the depth of report nesting you can have. However, there must be no circular references to reports. In other words, a report cannot contain a reference to itself as a subreport.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Field.SubreportHasData
member.summary: Returns whether a subreport has data and suppresses rendering if it doesn't.
member.remarks: This property allows you to check whether a subreport has data and prevent it from rendering if it doesn't.
member.example:
The code below uses script to hide sections with empty subreports:
rep.Sections.Detail.OnFormat = "Detail.Visible = fSubreport.SubreportHasData"
The code below uses script to hide a field containing an empty subreport and show another field instead:
rep.Sections.Detail.OnFormat = "hasData = fSubreport.SubreportHasData\r\n" + "fSubreport.Visible = hasData" + "fNoData.Visible = Not hasData\r\n" +

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Field.Calculated
member.summary: Specifies whether the property should be interpreted as a literal value or as a calculated expression.

remarks.para: If this property is set to false, the value of the property is rendered on the report without any further processing.
If it is set to true, the value of the property is evaluated as a VBScript expression and the result of the expression is rendered on the report.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Field.HideDuplicates
member.summary: Specifies whether duplicate values in consecutive records should be suppressed.

remarks.para: You can use the property to hide a field on a report when its value is the same as in the preceding record.
For example, on a report listing suppliers and their products, each supplier's name can appear once for each group of products, rather than once for each product.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Field.RunningSum
member.summary: Specifies whether to show a running sum for the field.

remarks.para: You can use the property to calculate record-by-record or group-by-group totals in a report.
The property specifies whether a calculated field on a report displays a running total and lets you set the range over which values are accumulated.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Field.WordWrap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether automatic word wrapping is on.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Field.LineSpacing
member.summary:
Gets or sets the line spacing between text lines in the field, in percent. The default is 100 which corresponds to normal line spacing.
Note that this property is ignored if is true.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Field.Font
member.summary: Gets or sets the field's font.
member.remarks: If you set a field's font property to a value that is too large to fit the field box (defined by the property), no text will appear in the field.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Field.TextAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the angle of text rotation within the field (including barcodes).
member.remarks: Note that some output/export formats (such as RTF and plain text) do not support rotated text.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Field.CanGrow
member.summary: Specifies whether the field height should be automatically increased to fit the field's contents.

remarks.para: You can use the and properties to control the appearance of report fields and sections. When you set both properties to true, the field or section automatically adjusts so any amount of data can be printed. When a field grows or shrinks, the fields below it move down or up the page.

If you set a field's property to true, the control automatically sets the property of the containing section to true. (However, if you set a control's property to true, the control doesn't set the section's property to true.)
When you use the and properties, remember that:
1. The property settings don't affect the horizontal spacing between fields; they affect only the vertical space the fields occupy.

2. The height of a large field can prevent fields beside it from shrinking. For example, if several short controls are on the left side of a report's detail section and one tall control, such as an unbound object frame, is on the right side, the controls on the left won't shrink, even if they contain no data.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Field.CanShrink
member.summary: Specifies whether the field height should be automatically reduced to fit the field's contents.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Field.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the field's size, in twips.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Field.Location
member.summary: Gets or sets the field's location within the section, in twips.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Field.ForeColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the field's foreground color.
member.remarks: Use the ForeColor property to specify the color for text in a field. You can use this property to make fields easy to read or to convey a special meaning.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Field.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets a string used to format the field value.

remarks.para: You can use the property to customize the way numbers, dates, times, and text are displayed and printed.
For example, if you've created a Price field, you can set its property to "Currency". If the field value is set to "4321.678", it would be rendered as $4,321.68.
You can use the property to format numbers (including currency and percentage values), dates, boolean values, and strings.
The syntax for the format string is the same used with the .NET method.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Field.Align
member.summary: Gets or sets the text alignment within the field.

remarks.para: This property determines how text is aligned within the field.
To control picture alignment, use the property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Field.BorderStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the field's border style.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Field.LineWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the field's border or line.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Field.BorderColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the field's border color.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Field.Picture
member.summary: Gets or sets a picture to display on the field.

remarks.para: You may set this property to three types of object:
1) Regular .NET objects.
2) Strings containing image file names or Urls.
3) Strings containing names of image fields in the report data source.
Options 1 and 2 are used to create unbound images, such as logos. These images do not depend on the report data.
Option 3 is used to create bound images, such as product or employee pictures. These are images stored with the report data.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Field.PictureAlign
member.summary: Gets or sets how field pictures should be the aligned.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Field.PictureScale
member.summary: Gets or sets how images should be the scaled to fit within the field area.

remarks.para: Depending on the setting of this property, images may be clipped, stretched, scaled (which preserves the image's aspect ratio), tiled, or hidden.
PictureScale works with the property so you can control image scaling and alignment independently.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Field.CheckBox

member.remarks: If you set this property to true, any fields containing text enclosed in curly brackets will be rendered as RTF. This allows you to add complex formatting within a field.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.SubreportField.SubreportHasData
member.summary: Returns whether a subreport has data and suppresses rendering if it doesn't.
member.remarks: This property allows you to check whether a subreport has data and prevent it from rendering if it doesn't.
member.example:
The code below uses script to hide sections with empty subreports:
rep.Sections.Detail.OnFormat = "Detail.Visible = fSubreport.SubreportHasData"
The code below uses script to hide a field containing an empty subreport and show another field instead:
rep.Sections.Detail.OnFormat = "hasData = fSubreport.SubreportHasData\r\n" + "fSubreport.Visible = hasData" + "fNoData.Visible = Not hasData\r\n" +

member.summary: Gets or sets a string used to format the field value.

remarks.para: You can use the property to customize the way numbers, dates, times, and text are displayed and printed.
For example, if you've created a Price field, you can set its property to "Currency". If the field value is set to "4321.678", it would be rendered as $4,321.68.
You can use the property to format numbers (including currency and percentage values), dates, boolean values, and strings.

member.summary: Gets the current page size, in twips.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Layout.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the report's detail section, in twips.

remarks.para: This property determines the width of the detail section of the report.
Multi-column reports have header and footer sections that span all columns so their actual width is * .
For example, a two-column report with a one-inch wide detail section would have Width = 1440, and its total width would be 2 * 1440 = 2880.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Layout.MarginLeft
member.summary: Gets or sets the left margin for each page, in twips.
member.remarks: The margins are measured in twips, from the edges of the paper. You can select the paper size and orientation using the and properties.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Layout.MarginRight
member.summary: Gets or sets the right margin for each page, in twips.
member.remarks: The margins are measured in twips, from the edges of the paper. You can select the paper size and orientation using the and properties.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Layout.MarginTop
member.summary: Gets or sets the top margin for each page, in twips.
member.remarks: The margins are measured in twips, from the edges of the paper. You can select the paper size and orientation using the and properties.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Layout.MarginBottom
member.summary: Gets or sets the bottom margin for each page, in twips.
member.remarks: The margins are measured in twips, from the edges of the paper. You can select the paper size and orientation using the and properties.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Layout.Columns
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of detail columns.

remarks.para: Use this property to create multi-column reports.

In multi-column reports, header and footer sections span the full width of the report. Only the detail section is rendered in multiple columns. Use the property to specify the width of each column, and the property to specify whether columns should be laid out across the page or down the page.

Multi-column reports are useful for printing reports on mailing labels and other types of multi-column pre-printed forms. They are also useful for creating compact reports where detail information is laid out across the page.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Layout.ColumnLayout
member.summary: Gets or sets the layout for the columns (down or across).

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Layout.PaperSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the paper size for the report.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Layout.CustomWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom width for the report, in twips.

remarks.para: To create reports using custom paper sizes, set the property to custom, then set the and properties to the size of the page measured in twips.
If the is set to a value other than custom, the paper size is determined by that setting. The and properties are not used in this case.
If the is set to custom and the or properties are set to zero, the printer's default paper size is used.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Layout.CustomHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom height for the report, in twips.

remarks.para: To create reports using custom paper sizes, set the property to custom, then set the and properties to the size of the page measured in twips.
If the is set to a value other than custom, the paper size is determined by that setting. The and properties are not used in this case.
If the is set to custom and the or properties are set to zero, the printer's default paper size is used.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Layout.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the page orientation.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Layout.PageHeader
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines on which pages the Page Header section should be displayed.

remarks.para: You can use the PageHeader and PageFooter properties to specify whether a report's page header or page footer should be printed on the same page as a report header or report footer.
For example, you might not want to print a page header containing the page number on the first page of a report if the report header is a cover sheet.

The Chart field has different set of properties to define the 2D and 3D chart.
Specific 2D chart properties: ChartArea2D, ChartGroups2D, VisualEffects.
Specific 3D chart properties: ChartArea3D, ChartGroups3D.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.ChartField.UseGrayscale
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to render the chart in grayscale instead of in color.
member.remarks: The use of Grayscale is intended as a preview for output to a black and white device. It does not affect style brush or pen colors internally, only the rendering of the chart to the output devices and images. Using grayscale implies the use of double buffered output.

member.name: T:C1.Win.FlexReport.Section
member.summary: Represents a report band.

remarks.para: Each object contains a collection of objects.
Every report contains the following sections:
A detail section.
A report header and a report footer section.
A page header and a page footer section.
A group header and a group footer section for each object in the report.
The total number of sections in a report is therefore 5 + 2 * Groups.Count. Sections cannot be added and removed from reports directly. The number of sections is a function of the number of groups.
Although sections cannot be removed, they can be hidden by setting their property to false.

member.name: M:C1.Win.FlexReport.Section.AssignFrom(C1.Win.FlexReport.ReportObject,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Assigns (copies) properties from another to the current object. This method copies list of subsections but does not copy list of fields. This method does NOT copy type of the section.
member.param: The source object to copy properties from.
Indicates whether the name should be copied.

member.summary: Gets the object that contains this .

member.summary: Gets or sets the name.

remarks.para: The section name can be used as an index into the control's collection.
Section names are also used to identify fields in VBScript expressions.
Duplicate and empty section names are allowed, but should be avoided if you plan to use the section names in scripts or as indexers.

When you add a field to a section's Fields collection, the field is automatically assigned to the section that owns the collection. For example, the code below adds a field to the Detail section:

member.summary: Specifies whether the will be rendered in the report.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Section.Height
member.summary: Gets the height of the current section in twips. This is the sum of the heights of all sub-sections of the current section.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Section.AutoHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining how the height of the section changes depending on its content.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Section.CanGrow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the section's height is automatically increased to fit its content.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Section.CanShrink
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the section's height should be reduced when one or more fields shrink.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Section.KeepTogether
member.summary: Specifies whether the should be kept together on a page.

remarks.para: The and objects also have KeepTogether properties.
The object's property works across sections. It determines whether group headers should be kept together with their first detail section or whether entire groups should be kept together on a page.
The object's property determines whether the field should be rendered on a single page or whether it is allowed to be split across page breaks.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Section.SplitBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining how the section behaves when it is too high to fit in the vertical space available on the current page.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Section.ForcePageBreak
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining whether page breaks should be inserted before and/or after the section.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Section.Repeat
member.summary: For group header, group footer and report footer sections only, gets or sets a value indicating whether the current section should be repeated at the top or bottom of each page. The default is false.

remarks.para: This property only applies to group header and group footer sections.
Set this value to true to repeat the group header page at the top of every page, before the detail sections.
If you have multiple groups, all group header sections that have the Repeat property set to true will be rendered at the top of each page.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Section.PrintAtPageBottom
member.summary:
For master report's footer sections only, gets or sets a value indicating whether the current section should print at the bottom of the page immediately above the page footer, rather than right below the detail. The default is false.
This property is ignored for non-footer sections or for footers of sub-reports.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Section.UseColumnLayout
member.summary: For master report's group and detail sections only, gets or sets a value indicating whether the current section should use column layout defined by and properties.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Section.OnFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing VBScript code to be executed before the is formatted.

remarks.para: This property contains VBScript instructions to be executed before the fields in the section are calculated. When this script is executed, the recordset already holds the data that will be displayed in the section, but the field values have not been updated yet.

Use this event to assign values to fields before they are calculated, so the new values will be taken into account when the control calculates the field's size and position when the or properties are set to true.
If you want to set field properties based on the field's current value, use the property instead.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Section.OnPrint
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing VBScript code to be executed before the is printed (after it is formatted).
member.remarks: This property contains VBScript instructions that get executed after the fields in the section have been calculated.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Section.Calculated
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current section has already been calculated and its property contains a valid value.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Section.RenderHeight
member.summary:
Gets the actual height of the current section. This is the sum of the heights of all its sub-sections. This property can only be used while the report is being rendered, otherwise it returns -1.
Note that if this property is used in the section's OnFormat script, then it returns the height calculated for the previous instance of the section, or -1 if this is the first calculation.

Getting this property can throw an exception if the height of sections was not calculated yet, for example if you access the RenderHeight of the report footer while the report header is being rendered.

remarks.para: When a sub-section grows or shrinks, its property does not change.
If you need to retrieve the actual height that will be used to rendering the sub-section (for example in the event), use the property instead.

member.summary: Gets a string that represents this .

member.name: M:C1.Win.FlexReport.PictureHolder.FromObject(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary:
Creates a new instance of the from a specified object. Object can be:
Null valueAn empty PictureHolder will be created.
String String represents an expression, a file or an url.
object.
object.
Byte array.Array containing the image data.
member.remarks:
The following rules are used when the object is a string:
If the string starts with "=" or "[", it is interpretted as an expression, and the actual image will be resolved when the report executes.
String is interpretted as a file name. The file name can be relative or absolute. If it is relative, then the following base paths are tried in order: , , .
String is interpretted as a URL. The URL can be relative or absolute. If it is relative, then the following base paths are tried in order: , and .
member.param: The value providing data for the new object.
The base path for resolving a relative file name.
member.returns: The new instance of the PictureHolder type.

member.summary: Gets the name (X, Y, Y2 or Z) of the axis.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Chart.ChartAxis.AnnoFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the annotation format for the axis.

remarks.para: The AnnoFormat property allow specification of numeric and date/time formats using enumerated values.

For numeric values, each of the enumerations specify formatting similar to that specified by the .Net , including Currency, General, Exponential, Percentage, Roundtrip and Hexadecimal. NumericManual is used in conjunction with the AnnoFormatString property to specify a custom format string.

For date/time values, each of the enumerations specify formatting similar to that specified by the .Net class, including combinations of long and short dates and times, and universal time representations. DateManual is used in conjunction with the AnnoFormatString property to specify a custom format string.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Chart.ChartAxis.AnnoFormatString
member.summary: Gets or sets the annnotation format string used with manual formats.

remarks.para: Only used when property is NumericManual or DateManual. The AnnoFormatString property specifies a custom string for formatting the annotations along the axis.

When the AnnoFormat property is NumericManual, the AnnoFormatString property can be set to format strings as described by the .Net double.ToString(AnnoFormatString) method call. Custom numeric format strings are described in detail by the .Net documentation under "Custom Numeric Format Strings". If the AnnoFormatString property is empty, then "g" or General is used.

When the AnnoFormat property is DateManual, the AnnoFormatString property can be set to format string as described by the .Net DateTime.ToString(AnnoFormatSTring) method call. Custom DateTime format strings are described in detail by the .Net documentation under "Date and Time Format Strings". If the AnnoFormatString property is empty, then ChartField selects a format string appropriate for the time span defined by the axis maximum and minimum values.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Chart.Chart2DAxis.Compass
member.summary: Gets or sets the general positioning of the axis. X may be set to North/South, Y and Y2 may be set to East/West.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Chart.Chart2DAxis.AutoOrigin
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the axis origin is caculated automatically.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Chart.Chart2DAxis.Origin
member.summary: Gets or sets the axis origin, the value on axis where the perpendicular axis is rendered.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Chart.Chart2DAxis.AnnoMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the method of annotation.
member.remarks: Chart2DAnnotationMethodEnum has three possible values, Auto, ValueLabels or Values. Values annotation can be used with any chart type in any instance. ValueLablels annotation cannot be used on the X-axis and the Y-axis for Pie charts. Auto annotation will use Values annotation (numeric chart) or ValueLabels (category chart) annotation automatically for different chart types.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Chart.Chart2DAxis.AnnoRotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the clockwise angle of rotation for the axis annotations, in degrees.
member.remarks: Rotations between +/- 30 to +/- 60 degrees are ideal for X-axis annotation when a large number of labels are desired.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Chart.Chart2DAxis.IsLogarithmic
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the axis is scaled logarithmically.
member.remarks: Logarithmic scaling does not make mathematical sense when values are less than or equal to zero. Therefore, negative and zero values are not plotted against axes that have the IsLogarithmic property set to true.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Chart.Chart2DAxis.GridMajor
member.summary: Gets the major grid lines object. Major grids are placed coincident with major tick marks at intervals. The GridMajor property is used to set the grid line appearance.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Chart.Chart2DAxis.GridMinor
member.summary: Gets the minor grid lines object. Minor grids are placed coincident with minor tick marks at intervals. The GridMinor property is used to set the grid line appearance.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Chart.Chart2DAxis.LogarithmicBase
member.summary: Gets or sets the base of the logarithmic scale used. Less than or equal to 1 specifies natural logs.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Chart.Chart2DAxis.NoAnnoOverlap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether axis annotations are permitted to overlap.
member.remarks: Setting NoAnnoOverlap suppresses the drawing of any axis annotation that would overlap a previously drawn annotation regardless of the reason for the overlap. This property does not change scaling or generation of major and minor tick marks. The property is not normally required for applications with AutoMajor set to true.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Chart.Chart2DAxis.OnTop
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether axis and gridlines appear on top of the chart image.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Chart.Chart2DAxis.Reversed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the axis is normal or reversed (ascending or descending).

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Chart.Chart2DAxis.Thickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the line thickness of the axis in twips.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Chart.Chart2DAxis.TickFactorMajor
member.summary: Gets or sets an integral factor for major tick mark length.
member.remarks: Tick marks are sized based on the thickness of the axis line as well as the tick factor. Doubling the tick factor doubles the length of the axis tick mark. Values are limited to integers from 1 to 20. Values outside of this range are ignored.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Chart.Chart2DAxis.TickFactorMinor
member.summary: Gets or sets an integral factor for minor tick mark length.
member.remarks: Tick marks are sized based on the thickness of the axis line as well as the tick factor. Doubling the tick factor doubles the length of the axis tick mark. Values are limited to integers from 1 to 20. Values outside of this range are ignored.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Chart.Chart2DAxis.TickGauge
member.summary: Gets or sets the approximate number of intervals delineated by gauge marks between major tick marks.
member.remarks: Gauge marks are oversized minor tick marks used to subdivide minor ticks for easy reading. Use 0 for none (default), 1 for automatic and > 1 for approximate number of sections of minor tick marks delimited by gauge marks between each set of major tick marks.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Chart.Chart2DAxis.TickLabels
member.summary: Gets or sets the placement of the annotation labels relative to the axis. Axis annotations can be placed on the chart in several positions or not at all.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Chart.Chart2DAxis.TickMajor
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of major tick mark.
member.remarks: Tick marks can be place on either side or both sides of the axis line. Note that if the TickMajor property is set to then major tick marks are not drawn.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Chart.Chart2DAxis.TickMinor
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of minor tick mark.
member.remarks: Tick marks can be placed on either side or both sides of the axis line. Note that if the TickMinor property is set to , then minor tick marks are not drawn.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Chart.Chart2DAxis.ValueLabels
member.summary: Gets the Chart2DValueLabels collection for this axis.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Chart.Chart2DAxis.VerticalText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the label text is displayed vertically.
member.remarks: Inherits from the chart area. VerticalText allows some double byte characters to be rendered from top to bottom instead of left to right. For single byte characters VerticalText appears as rotated text, 90 degrees in the clockwise direction.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Chart.Chart2DAxis.Rotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotational orientation of the textual caption of the axis. Inherits from the chart area.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Chart.Chart2DAxis.ForeColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the foreground color. Inherits from the chart area. The ForeColor is used to set the color of the axis line and annotations.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Chart.Chart2DAxis.Font
member.summary: Gets or sets the FontHolder object. Inherits from the chart area.

member.name: P:C1.Win.FlexReport.Chart.Chart2DAxis.Alignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the text alignment within the axis display. Inherits from chart area.
